intro: Anthericum xylorrhizum, commonly known as the rock fern, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces spore-bearing structures called sorus, which are typically located on the underside of its leaves. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Anthericum xylorrhizum is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
